9h4ey.question: Emergency Descent from FL370: Which statement is correct?

options.text: With the N/100% selector to NORMAL the mask provides the flight crew with a mixture of air and oxygen. This  mixture changes with cabin altitude. The higher the cabin altitude, the more oxygen the mask provides until the  mask supplies 100% oxygen
With the N/100% selector to NORMAL the mask provides the flight crew with 100% Oxygen until FL100
With the N/100% selector to NORMAL the mask provides the flight crew with a constant mixture of cabin air  (30%) and oxygen (70%) through the entire descent
With the N/100% selector to NORMAL the mask provides the flight crew with 100% oxygen until FL330 and  then mixture of cabin air and oxygen

kt4s6.question: If the N/100% regulator is set to “N”, it delivers a mixture of air and oxygen to the mask, the content of  which varies with cabin altitude. When cabin altitude goes _________, the air inlet closes and the wearer breathes  100 % oxygen.

options.text: Above 35000 feet
Above 31000 feet
Above 39000 feet

8262n.question: The minimum bottle pressure of the cockpit fixed oxygen system takes the following into account:

options.text: Protection after loss of cabin pressure, with mask regulator on NORMAL (diluted oxygen) during an emergency  descent: For all cockpit members for 5 min
Protection in case of smoke, with 100 % oxygen: For all cockpit members for 15 min at a cabin altitude of 8'000  ft
Protection after loss of cabin pressure, with mask regulator on NORMAL (diluted oxygen) during an emergency  descent: For all cockpit members for 25 min
Protection in case of smoke, with 100 % oxygen: For all cockpit members for 15 min at a cabin altitude of  36'000 ft

085vr.question: When does the flight crew have to use the oxygen masks?

options.text: Whenever the cabin altitude exceeds 10'000ft for a period in excess of 30 minutes
All answers are correct
In case of smoke in the cockpit
Whenever the cabin altitude exceeds 13'000ft

kkqtkh.question: What is the last point of the oxygen mask test?

options.text: Check if the left door of the oxygen mask box is closed
No REGUL LO PR message on the ECAM page
It is correctly stowed
Check if the N 100% selector is in the N position

9nu2k.question: Oxygen system (cockpit): on ECAM DOOR/OXY page, CKPT OXY indication is normally green .It becomes  amber when:

options.text: Low oxygen pressure is detected
The OXYGEN CREW SUPPLY pb on the overhead panel is OFF
Pressure goes below 300 PSI
All answers are correct

8kbog.question: OXYGEN STOWAGE BOX: As soon as the left flap door opens, the mask is supplied with oxygen and, once  it closes (mask still supplied with oxygen), the ____ flag appears.

options.text: NO OXYGEN
LOW OXY
OXY ON
OXY OFF

ufx0h.question: FIXED OXYGEN SYSTEM FOR CABIN - The generation of oxygen begins when the passenger pulls the mask  towards the passenger seat. The mask receives pure oxygen under positive pressure for about ___ min, until the  generator is exhausted

options.text: 12 min
10 min
20 min
15 min

5ixuv.question: FIXED OXYGEN SYSTEM FOR CABIN - Each container has an electrical latching mechanism that opens  automatically to allow the masks to drop if:

options.text: The cabin pressure altitude exceeds 14 000 ft exactly. The flight crew can not override the automatic control
The cabin pressure altitude exceeds 14 000 ft (+ 250, - 750 ft). The flight crew can not override the automatic  control
The cabin pressure altitude exceeds 14 000 ft (+ 250, - 750 ft). The flight crew can override the automatic  control
The cabin pressure altitude exceeds 14 000 ft exactly. The flight crew can override the automatic control

palin.question: What measuring unit is used to depict the cockpit oxygen system pressure on the ECAM?

options.text: QT
KG
L
PSI

lics8.question: What can be done in order to relase a cabin oxygen mask, when the door fails to open?

options.text: Nothing
The Manual Release Tool (MRT) can be used by cabin crew to open affected containers
Provide first aid oxygen
Repeatedly (4 times) press the MASK MAN ON pb

jhtna.question: What is indicated by a missing green pressure plug on the right fwd fuselage below F/O window during an  exterior preflight check?

options.text: An external fire extinguisher has been discharged
The crew oxygen bottle is empty
This is a normal indication, the green pressure plug only appears if the oxygen cylinder pressure is low
An oxygen system overpressure or thermal discharge

t643m.question: The illumination of the PASSENGER SYS ON light is an indication that:

options.text: The crew oxygen cylinder is empty
All of the passenger masks have deployed
The crew must depress the MASK MAN ON Pb in order to deploy the masks
The control for the oxygen mask doors is activated

ut116.question: With reference to the OXY high pressure indication, which of the following is wrong?

options.text: It pulses in green, when the pressure is < 600 PSI
On ground, an amber half frame appears when oxygen pressure is < 1100 PSI
It is amber, when the pressure is < 300 PSI
It is green, when the pressure is equal or higher than 600 PSI

bwncm.question: FIXED OXYGEN SYSTEM FOR CABIN. Which statement is correct?

options.text: Supplies oxygen for cabin occupants in case of depressurization and noxious gases
Supplies oxygen for cabin occupants in case of depressurization, smoke and noxious gases
Supplies oxygen for cabin occupants in case of depressurization and smoke
Supplies oxygen for cabin occupants in case of depressurization only

enky6.question: When is the FCM oxygen mask supplied with oxygen?

options.text: As soon as the right flap door of mask container is opened
As soon as you push the RESET/TEST control slide
As soon as the left flap door of mask container is opened
The mask is always supplied by oxygen

tg1nv.question: FIXED OXYGEN SYSTEM FOR COCKPIT. Which statement about the EMERGENCY pressure selector is  correct?

options.text: Overpressure supply is automatically started, when the cabin altitude exceeds 25’000ft
Overpressure supply is only available when the N/100% selector is set to 100% and will be automatically  started, when the cabin altitude exceeds 30’000ft
Overpressure supply is started as soon as you put on the mask and the N/100% selector is set to 100%
Overpressure supply is available when the N/100% selector is set to 100% or NORMAL and will be  automatically started, when the cabin altitude exceeds 30’000ft

5cisc.question: What does the PASSENGER SYS ON light mean?

options.text: Passenger oxygen masks are all deployed
This light comes on white, when the control for the oxygen mask door is activated.
Passenger oxygen has been requested by cabin crew through the FAP. Cockpit Crew has to push the button to  allow the masks to drop
Passenger oxygen is needed due to loss of cabin pressure

y49ajj.question: When stowing the crew oxygen mask, when will the integrated microphone be deactivated automatically?

options.text: After pressing the test button on the mask
After closing the oxygen mask doors
The microphone is not deactivated
After closing the left flap of the oxygen mask door and having presed the RESET button

8w3fzk.question: If the oxygen masks fail to deploy automatically how else can they be deployed?

options.text: They can be deployed by pressing the MASK MAN ON pb on the overhead panel.
They can be deployed by the flight attendants using the CIDS panel.
They can be deployed by pressing the PASSENGER SYS ON pb on the overhead panel.
They cannot be deployed if the automatic system fails.

11zys.question: On the ECAM DOOR/OXY page, the OXY indication becomes amber when: (more than one answer is  correct)

options.text: Low oxygen pressure is detected.
Pressure goes below 300 psi.
The OXYGEN CREW SUPPLY pushbutton switch on overhead panel is OFF.
All answers are correct.

ig8hg.question: The flight crew can not override the automatic control of the cabin oxygen system.

xjnrf.question: OVHD Panel: The PASSENGER SYS ON light comes on ________ when the control for the oxygen mask  doors is activated.

options.text: White
Blue
Amber
A fixed oxygen system for the cockpit.
All answers are correct.
A fixed oxygen system for the cabin.
A portable oxygen system.

dre0l.question: Fixed oxygen system cabin: Each chemical generator container has an electrical latching mechanism that  opens automatically to allow the masks to drop, if the cabin pressure altitude exceeds  ________________________.
